NEW PAGE 29
ARTICLE VI.
GENERAL PROVISIONS AND SUPPLEMENTARY REGULATIONS
2.
Churches and cemeteries.
3.
Fire stations, schools, and other public buildings.
4.
Group Development under the provisions of Section 7.05.
5.
Automobile Carwash, with the following conditions: (As amended March 7, 2000)
a. Provision must be made SO that there will be no automobile stacking on public
streets and/or right-of-ways.
b. The issue of loitering must be addressed to the satisfaction of the Chocowinity
Police Department.
c. Provisions must be provided for the ongoing maintenance of the facility, SO
that it is at all times in compliance with Federal, State, County, and Municipal
Ordinances/Code/Regulations/Policies.
d. Provisions must be made for sewage, runoff, and drainage, surface and
subsurface to the satisfaction of Municipal Engineer.
e.
Provisions must be made for buffering and screening for locations proximate
to residential or other sensitive uses, such as churches, house of worship, etc.
f.
Provision must be made for hours of operation compatible with both surround
zoning and land use.
7.
Repair and storage of automobile and trucks (As amended March 2, 2010)
8.
Automobile Sales (New and Used) and Service (As amended June 6, 2017)
9.
Funeral Home, with the following conditions: (As amended August 1, 2017)
a. The use shall be arranged SO that adequate assembly area is provided off-
street for vehicles to be used in a funeral procession
b. All required federal, state, and local licensing and permits shall be maintained
at all times.
C. Provisions must be made for sewage, runoff, and draining, surface and
subsurface to the satisfaction of the Municipal Engineer or Public Works
Director.
d. There shall be a minimum of one (1) parking spot for every three (3) seats in
the viewing room.
D.
Dimensional Requirements for Business Lots in the General Business District
1.
Minimum lot size: 20,000 square feet. In addition, a visual vegetative buffer is
required where a commercial use or zone abuts a residential use or zone. (Amended
by the Town Board on July 13, 1999.)
2.
Maximum height of the B-1 District will be 35 feet.
3.
Minimum front yard shall be ten (10) feet, except where sidewalks are provided.
4.
Minimum side yard shall be eight (8) feet, except if a common wall exists between
buildings, no side yard shall be required.
SECTION 6.07.
B-2 HIGHWAY COMMERCIAL DISTRICT
A.
Intent
The B-2 District intent is to provide for and encourage the proper grouping and development
of roadside uses which will best accommodate the needs of the motoring public and the
reduction of highway congestion.
26

NEW PAGE 30
ARTICLE VI.
GENERAL PROVISIONS AND SUPPLEMENTARY REGULATIONS
B.
Permitted Use
The following shall be permitted by right:
C.
Special Uses
The following and possible other uses shall be permitted subject to the requirements of this
district and additional regulations and requirements imposed by the Board of Commissioners
as provided in Article VIII.
D.
Dimensional Requirements for B-2 Highway Commercial Districts
1.
Minimum lot size: 10,000 square feet.
2.
Minimum lot width shall be seventy-five (75) feet with a minimum lot depth of one
hundred twenty (120) feet.
3.
Minimum front yard depth shall be forty (40) feet from the right-of-way of the street.
The first fifteen (15) feet from the property line shall be developed for sidewalk, grass
and plants, and shall not be used for any purpose except for the necessary drives and
walks and shall not include off-street parking.
4.
No side yard shall be required except where a lot abuts a residential district a fifteen
(15) foot side yard and buffer shall be required. In other cases where a side yard, not
required is provided, it shall be at least three (3) feet in width.
5.
No sidewall is required if a commercial building is constructed with a common wall.
27

NEW PAGE 31
ARTICLE VI.
GENERAL PROVISIONS AND SUPPLEMENTARY REGULATIONS
6.
No portion of any entrance driveway leading from a public street shall be closer than
twenty (20) feet to the corner of any intersection measured from the right-of-way line.
7.
The width of any entrance driveway leading from the public street shall not exceed
thirty-six (36) feet at its intersection with curb or street line. No two (2) driveways
leading from a public street shall be within twenty (20) feet of each other measured
along the full height of the curb.
8.
On any corner lot there shall be no planting, structure, fence or other obstruction to
visibility within the range of three (3) to seven (7) feet above level within twenty-five
(25) feet of the intersection of any two (2) right-of-way lines.
SECTION 6.08.
L1 LIGHT INDUSTRIAL DISTRICT
A.
Intent
The light industrial district is intended to create and protect areas for those industrial uses
which do not create excessive noise, odor, smoke, dust, and which do not possess other
objectionable characteristics which might be detrimental to surrounding neighborhoods or to
the other uses permitted in the district.
B.
Permitted Uses

NEW PAGE 33
ARTICLE VI.
GENERAL PROVISIONS AND SUPPLEMENTARY REGULATIONS
C.
Special Uses Permitted
The following uses and possible others are permitted subject to the requirements of this
district and any additional regulations and requirements imposed by the Board of
Commissioners as provided in Article VIII.
1.
Manufacturing uses not otherwise named herein which come with the spirit or intent
of this Zoning Ordinance.
2.
Junkyards
3.
Detention centers, jails, emergency operations centers, and related facilities (As
amended June 3, 2014)
A. Setbacks
a. The principal structure shall be located a minimum of one hundred
(100) feed from an adjacent residential use or zoning district.
b.
No principal or accessory building shall exceed forty (40) feet in
height within one hundred (100) feed of a residential use or zoning
district.
C. Accessory uses and security fencing attendant to the principal
structure shall be fifty (50) feet from an adjacent residential use or
zoning district.
B. Fencing materials such as barbed wire, razor wire, or electrical fences may
not be used within sixty (60) feet of an adjacent residential use or zoning
district unless screened from view or otherwise approved by the Chocowinity
Board of Commissioners.
C. All lighting for the facility must be oriented SO that lighting is directed away
from all adjoining properties and into the property.
D. Exercise yards and other outdoor activity areas shall be located internally on
the site and screened from view from adjacent properties and public ways.
E. Vehicle storage: Except law enforcement, staff, and visitor vehicles; all
vehicles associated with the use shall be store in an enclosed or screened area.
The vehicle storage area may be screen with vegetation, fences, a combination
of fences and landscape material, or other means designed to effectively
screen the stored vehicles from adjacent properties and the public way.
F. Vehicles entering and/or leaving the facility shall not use sirens or emergency
lights unless responding to an emergency.
D.
Dimensional Requirements for L1 Light Industrial Districts
1.
Minimum lot area shall be one (1) acre.
2.
Minimum lot width shall be two hundred (200) feet.
3.
Minimum front yard shall be fifty (50) feet.
4.
Minimum side yard on each side of every principal building shall be fifteen (15) feet.
5.
Minimum required rear yard shall be twenty (20) feet.
6.
The total ground area covered by the principal building and all accessory buildings
shall not exceed forth percent (40%) of the total lot area.
7.
No building shall exceed fifty (50) feet in height unless the depth of the front and total
width of the side yards herein shall be increased by one (1) foot for each two (2) feet,
or fraction thereof, of building height in excess of fifty (50) feet.
30

ARTICLE VI.
GENERAL PROVISIONS AND SUPPLEMENTARY REGULATIONS
C.
Special Uses Permitted
The following uses and possible others are permitted subject to the requirements of this
district and any additional regulations and requirements imposed by the Board of

NEW PAGE 34
ARTICLE VI.
GENERAL PROVISIONS AND SUPPLEMENTARY REGULATIONS
8.
Buildings legally constructed or legally converted to uses permitted in this district
shall provide off-street loading and unloading space as required in Section 7.01. D. of
this ordinance.
SECTION 6.09.
OI OFFICE AND INSTITUTIONAL DISTRICT
(As amended September 6, 2006)
A.
Intent
This District is developed to provide space for institutions (public or private), office uses, and
certain commercial uses which have limited or specialized contact with the general public.
This is not inclusive of merchandising establishments (retail or wholesale). Due to the
complementary nature of these uses and the regulations governing their development,
residential uses are also permitted within the District.
B.
Permitted Uses
The following uses shall be permitted by right:
1.
Single family residential uses
2.
Bed and Breakfast Inn
3.
Business Services
4.
Public Service
C.
Special Uses Permitted
31
CELL (1, 1): 
a.
CELL (1, 2): 
Advertising
CELL (2, 1): 
b.
CELL (2, 2): 
Brokerage
CELL (3, 1):

Dimensional Requirements for OI Office and Institutional District
1.
Minimum lot size: 20,000 square feet (except that if served by an approved public
or community water and sewage disposal system, lot size may be reduced to 10,000
square feet)

exceed 20 feet in depth)
6.

percent
7.
Height limitations: 35 feet

Permitted Use
The following shall be permitted by right:
C.
Special Uses
The following and possible other uses shall be permitted subject to the requirements of this
district and additional regulations and requirements imposed by the Board of Commissioners
as provided in Article VIII.
D.
Dimensional Requirements for B-2 Highway Commercial Districts
1.
Minimum lot size: 10,000 square feet.
2.
Minimum lot width shall be seventy-five (75) feet with a minimum lot depth of one
hundred twenty (120) feet.
3.
Minimum front yard depth shall be forty (40) feet from the right-of-way of the street.
The first fifteen (15) feet from the property line shall be developed for sidewalk, grass
and plants, and shall not be used for any purpose except for the necessary drives and
walks and shall not include off-street parking.
4.
No side yard shall be required except where a lot abuts a residential district a fifteen
(15) foot side yard and buffer shall be required. In other cases where a side yard, not
required is provided, it shall be at least three (3) feet in width.
5.
No sidewall is required if a commercial building is constructed with a common wall.

ARTICLE VI.
GENERAL PROVISIONS AND SUPPLEMENTARY REGULATIONS
6.
No portion of any entrance driveway leading from a public street shall be closer than
twenty (20) feet to the corner of any intersection measured from the right-of-way line.
7.
The width of any entrance driveway leading from the public street shall not exceed
thirty-six (36) feet at its intersection with curb or street line. No two (2) driveways
leading from a public street shall be within twenty (20) feet of each other measured
along the full height of the curb.
8.
On any corner lot there shall be no planting, structure, fence or other obstruction to
visibility within the range of three (3) to seven (7) feet above level within twenty-five
(25) feet of the intersection of any two (2) right-of-way lines.
SECTION 6.08.
L1 LIGHT INDUSTRIAL DISTRICT
A.
Intent
The light industrial district is intended to create and protect areas for those industrial uses
which do not create excessive noise, odor, smoke, dust, and which do not possess other
objectionable characteristics which might be detrimental to surrounding neighborhoods or to
the other uses permitted in the district.
B.

NEW PAGE 33
ARTICLE VI.
GENERAL PROVISIONS AND SUPPLEMENTARY REGULATIONS
C.
Special Uses Permitted
The following uses and possible others are permitted subject to the requirements of this
district and any additional regulations and requirements imposed by the Board of
Commissioners as provided in Article VIII.
1.
Manufacturing uses not otherwise named herein which come with the spirit or intent
of this Zoning Ordinance.
2.
Junkyards
3.
Detention centers, jails, emergency operations centers, and related facilities (As
amended June 3, 2014)
A. Setbacks
a. The principal structure shall be located a minimum of one hundred
(100) feed from an adjacent residential use or zoning district.
b.
No principal or accessory building shall exceed forty (40) feet in
height within one hundred (100) feed of a residential use or zoning
district.
C. Accessory uses and security fencing attendant to the principal
structure shall be fifty (50) feet from an adjacent residential use or
zoning district.
B. Fencing materials such as barbed wire, razor wire, or electrical fences may
not be used within sixty (60) feet of an adjacent residential use or zoning
district unless screened from view or otherwise approved by the Chocowinity
Board of Commissioners.
C. All lighting for the facility must be oriented SO that lighting is directed away
from all adjoining properties and into the property.
D. Exercise yards and other outdoor activity areas shall be located internally on
the site and screened from view from adjacent properties and public ways.
E. Vehicle storage: Except law enforcement, staff, and visitor vehicles; all
vehicles associated with the use shall be store in an enclosed or screened area.
The vehicle storage area may be screen with vegetation, fences, a combination
of fences and landscape material, or other means designed to effectively
screen the stored vehicles from adjacent properties and the public way.
F. Vehicles entering and/or leaving the facility shall not use sirens or emergency
lights unless responding to an emergency.
D.
Dimensional Requirements for L1 Light Industrial Districts
1.
Minimum lot area shall be one (1) acre.
2.
Minimum lot width shall be two hundred (200) feet.
3.
Minimum front yard shall be fifty (50) feet.
4.
Minimum side yard on each side of every principal building shall be fifteen (15) feet.
5.
Minimum required rear yard shall be twenty (20) feet.
6.
The total ground area covered by the principal building and all accessory buildings
shall not exceed forth percent (40%) of the total lot area.
7.
No building shall exceed fifty (50) feet in height unless the depth of the front and total
width of the side yards herein shall be increased by one (1) foot for each two (2) feet,
or fraction thereof, of building height in excess of fifty (50) feet.
30

NEW PAGE 34
ARTICLE VI.
GENERAL PROVISIONS AND SUPPLEMENTARY REGULATIONS
8.
Buildings legally constructed or legally converted to uses permitted in this district
shall provide off-street loading and unloading space as required in Section 7.01. D. of
this ordinance.
SECTION 6.09.
OI OFFICE AND INSTITUTIONAL DISTRICT
(As amended September 6, 2006)
A.
Intent
This District is developed to provide space for institutions (public or private), office uses, and
certain commercial uses which have limited or specialized contact with the general public.
This is not inclusive of merchandising establishments (retail or wholesale). Due to the
complementary nature of these uses and the regulations governing their development,
residential uses are also permitted within the District.
B.
Permitted Uses
The following uses shall be permitted by right:
1.
Single family residential uses
2.
Bed and Breakfast Inn
3.
Business Services
4.
Public Service
C.
Special Uses Permitted
